FuncDef:
The ntp-service port command changes the port number used to receive NTP packets.
The undo ntp-service port command restores the default port number.
By default, port 123 receives NTP packets.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the port number used to receive NTP packets.
The number is an integer that can be 123, or ranges from 1025 to 65535.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To improve security of network packets, run the ntp-service port command to configure the port number used to receive NTP packets. A user firewall filters packets based on that port number.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
Precautions
If this command is the first NTP configuration command, the system automatically adds the ntp-service [ ipv6 ] server disable command in the configuration file to disable the NTP service. To enable the NTP service, run the undo ntp-service [ ipv6 ] server disable command. If this command is the last NTP configuration command to be deleted, the system automatically deletes the ntp-service [ ipv6 ] server disable command from the configuration file.
